text: Helaletes is an extinct perissodactyl closely related to tapirs. Fossils have been found in North America. ==Taxonomy== The type species of Helaletes, H. nanus, is known from Bridgerian-age fossils in the western US.http://fossilworks.org/bridge.pl?a=taxonInfo&taxon;_no=46822 Desmatotherium mongoliensis was previously referred to Helaletes, but Bai et al. (2017) found it distantly related to the H. nanus type species, while excluding the nominal species H. medius Qiu, 1987 from Helaletidae.Bai B, Wang Y Q, Mao F Y et al., 2017. New material of Eocene Helaletidae (Perissodactyla, Tapiroidea) from the Irdin Manha Formation of the Erlian Basin, Inner Mongolia, China and comments on related localities of the Huheboerhe Area.
